metadata.title: CVE-2016-5291 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A same-origin policy bypass with local shortcut files to load arbitrarylocal content from disk. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 45.5,Firefox ESR < 45.5, and Firefox < 50.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5291` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.5.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
